item.title: Dorothy add a quote by Gandhi
item.description: "Your beliefs become your thoughts, Your thoughts become your words, Your words become your actions, Your actions become your habits, Your habits become your values, Your values become your destiny." -- Gandhi

item.title: Dorothy add a quote by Desmond Tutu (Foreword)
item.description: "If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor. If an elephant has its foot on the tail of a mouse, and you say that you are neutral, the mouse will not appreciate your neutrality." -- Desmond Tutu (Foreword)

item.title: Dorothy add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "You must live in the present, launch yourself on every wave, find your eternity in each moment. Fools stand on their island of opportunities and look toward another land. There is no other land; there is no other life but this." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dorothy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Dorothy add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dorothy add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "In the end these things matter most: How well did you love? How fully did you live? How deeply did you let go?" -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Dorothy add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions - the little, soon forgotten charities of a kiss or a smile, a kind look or heartfelt compliment." -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge
